favorite game

Counter-Strike: Source, ist der, meiner Meinung nach, beste Teil der Counter-Strike-Reihe.
In CS: Source geht es darum, mit seinem Team (Anti-Terror-Einheiten-CT / Terroristen-T), taktisch vorzugehen, um das jeweilige Ziel zu erreichen (Bombe entschärfen / Bombe platzieren oder Geiseln befreien / Geiselbefreiung verhindern).
Es gibt noch sehr viel mehr Spielmodi, die man auf den zahlreichen Online-Servern finden kann, z.B. Team-Deathmatch; Zombie-Modus; Gefängnis-Ausbruch uvm...
CS: Source bietet auch jemandem, der/die nicht gern Online spielt, einen lokalen BOT-Modus an. Zudem kann man sich auch einen eigenen LAN-Server erstellen und mit seinen Freunden zusammen spielen.
Mit einer sehr realistischen Physik / Ragdoll-Physik und einer ausreichend guten Graphik, sollte jeder ,,Taktik-Shooter-Liebhaber´´, zufriedengestellt werden können.
El Antiguo favorito 10/10

Эту игру невозмоно порекоменовать или нет, CS как серия - тупиковая ветвь.
Игра не имеет разнообразного геймплея, который мог бы заинтересовать хоть чем-то. Мне говорят: "Пошли в контру! Поиграем!". В  CS невозможно играть, в нее можно задрачиваться, именно задрачиваться! Вся суть игры отточить навыки, такие как: выпригивание из-за угла, стрельба в голову, быстрое переключение между оружием в нужный момент. Я научился этому за 5 часов игры, более она мне не интересна. Далее конечно идет следующий уровень: оттачивание командной игры. На этом уровне вам прийдется заучить примерно три сценария развития сюжета. Все! Уровень пройден! 
Нет, конечно в игре есть и плюсы, несомненно вы сможете натренировать реакцию, но тут есть вещь гораздо полезнее, приятнее и  не на много, но интереснее: натольный теннис. А лчшим из шутеров, всегда была, есть и будет ArmA!
Далее, когда вы уже увидели мое отншение к серии, я выскажусь именно об этой части игры, она является лучшей из всей серии, я играл в CS 1.6 с её графигой йи физикой, я играл в CS:GO с её глубоким уклоном в сторону MMO, и я ни смог найти в них ни одного плюса, который не перекрывался двумя минусами в сравнении с CS:S! В серии эта игра самая лучшая, но серия, как вы уже поняли не ахти!

Serious:
Despite only having played this for 2 hours (At the time of writing this review), I don't regret my purchase of this game, especially as it was under £4 when I bought it! The graphics in my opinion are pretty nice, especially for a 2004 game, even today they look quite nice. The gameplay features Terrorist VS Counter-Terrorists, and when you select a team, you have 4 different models to chose from for each team (Such as SAS and Seal Team 6 for Counter-Terrorists) and there are no classes. Instead of classes, you earn money to spend on guns and equipment in the next round, so as long as you can afford it and hold it in your inventory (I don't think you can carry multiple Assault Rifles e.t.c) you can pretty much make your own class. Want to be a Sniper with Night Vision? Go for it! Want to be a Shotgunner or Light Machine Gunner with an armored vest and helmet? Go ahead! If you are the kind of person who likes to communicate with the team or you have friends to play with, then teamwork will most likely be successful. Team work is the main point of this game after all. I'm not the kind of person who communicates with people I don't know, and I haven't played this with any of my friends yet, so team work hasn't been great for me, but that doesn't matter, it should be good for the majority of people. My only problems with this game, the maps can be a little too closed sometimes, but that's probably just me, and the armor doesn't feel like it does much (I know it does, it just doesn't feel like it (Probably because I keep getting headshotted)).

Graphics: 7/10
Audio: 6/10
Gameplay: 8/10
Overall: 8/10
This game is a classic!

Unserious:

Even if it's old, it's cool. I guess the only bad thing about it is that it's pretty hard to get into the swing of things online. I usually jsut play with bots until I get bored but sometimes I venture into the deep waters of the skilled player...

Played this game a lot back in the younger years of it, was a very intense FPS with a good community and clan base. Lots of different server types, mods, gun games all sorts. Very good fun.

Recently came back to the game after trying the new CS:GO, I can pretty much say this is the way better game out of the two and is still very well populated with many players playing all hours of the day.

Still seem to be a lot of top players playing on the servers, good people with 3000+ hours in game which I'm very glad to see.

and people are still happy to chat and be social during rounds in games as well, not many people really complaining or whining about anything. So overall this is the best choice in my opinion.

Fully recommended! Just don't pay the £15 on steam, get on steam sale or find key elsewhere ;)

I have been playing this game since like 2008(came out in '05 i think)(not always on this account) and I've always loved it! it's seriously the only game that I've always come back to. I'll buy a game for Xbox or PC but eventually i get bored. CS:S has always been there for if i need entertainment or to release some aggression. From how many servers there are to the diversity of the servers, its impossible to not have something to do. I can watch a movie and play the game windowed with no trouble at all. always runs smooth even when i had a lower tier computer. and even if you have a piece of scrap metal computer, there are servers with almost no textures that will play for almost everyone(I've played them using windows 2000). I cant really express how much i truly enjoy this game. If i could marry anyone in the world for the rest of my life, it would be Counter-Strike: Source.

Un juego bastante malo... y bastante bueno a la vez. Como cualquier cosa, posee sus aspectos positivos y sus aspectos negativos pero eso ya dependerá de la forma de jugar de cada quien.

Yo estoy acostumbrado a otro tipo de "shooters" como Battlefiled, y derrepente volver a esto es un cambio muy fuerte, así que  si eres de los que les gustan los juegos tácticos y con una buena detección de balas este juego no es lo tuyo.

Lo que le veo de malo a este juego, es la manera es que te mueves y disparas por los entornos, es mucho, mucho pero MUCHO muy probable que no llegues a disparar una sola bala cuando ya estas muerto, y tienes que esperar a que la ronda termine para reaparecer y es ETERNA.

Hay gente que le gusta esto, a mi no y casi me arrepiento de comprarlo, pero recorde que antes de comprarlo (cuando hace tiempo lo tenía pirata) jugaba en un mapa todo sin texturas pero ahí no habia tiempo de aparición ni límite de armas, sólo reaparición instantánea y armas "infinitas" sin tener que pagar el dinero que ganas matando, por suerte lo encontré (y ya con texturas :D) y creo que jugaré en ese mapa para siempre.

Conclusión:
Si no tienen paciencia, no lo compren.

ACTUALIZACIÓN:
Ahora que he jugado más me he percatado de que el 95% de los jugadores son profesionales con más de 1000 horas jugadas que te matan con la Deagle a medio mapa de distancia, esto es Counter y sólo puedo decir: o practicas insanamente o te matarán cada 5 segundos :D

The year was 2004 when I walked into a PC pub, I slapped down $2.25 to check out what PC gaming could offer me for an hour. I've heard of CS Source but I couldn't tell you from where. I logged in and started out on my first map cs_assault. Before you knew it, I had gave the guy behind the counter another $20 and played for 9 hours straight that day. I only stopped because they were closing. The next day at school, it was all I could think about and I couldn't leave school soon enough to give that guy behind the counter another $20 to play for another 8 hours. If you added those hours plus the hours I put when I finally got a CSS last Fall, I definitely had over 400 hours of this game logged. And I'm still not that great. There is someone always better than you in this game because 400+ hours is moderate to some of the people who play this game. Add the fact that this game is highly moddable, there's a reason this game is still in the gaming lexicon, mostly conscience.

PC gamer/FPS fan must have. My number 1 game of all time (yes, I played Half Life 2, about 8 years after it was released and I still don't understand the big deal) 

If this was the only game I could play for the rest of my life, I'd be ok with that.

The [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Counter-Strike_(series)]Counter-Strike series[/url] has always been a childhood game right from the day I first endured my experience on the PC. Counter-Strike: Condition Zero was the first one I ever played, the campaign remains in my mind today even though I no longer have it (I think?). When I saw that Source was available with Garry's Mod for all but a shilling, I had to grab it and give it a test run. Safe to say, I haven't been disappointed.

With a complete graphical overhaul, I was paying close attention to the detail of the weapons and smaller geometries around the world in addition to the character texturing/meshes. Valve pulled it off, and they did it well. I played this game for hours with a friend, jumping from server to server experiencing what I had never done before. Playing online at such a young age during Condition Zero was just something I never did. In my own personal opinion, Source is better than even the more modern day Call of Duty's, and it is from the same category (First-Person Shooter). I even think the sounds got some looking after as they seem to be much clearer then they did back in 2004. However, all good things must come to an end as I stopped my CS experience here: Global Offensive just does not appeal to me, at all. Onto the pros and cons!

Pros:
» Graphical overhaul has mentioned, a real step-up from Condition Zero.
» Sound also seems to be a big factor. I noticed that even the running sounds were revamped for the release.
» Animations were reworked as far as I can tell. One thing that stood out to me was the idle animation for the knife.
» Many online gamemods, great fun to play!
» Although this is a Valve product, it has great integration with Garry's Mod which is nice to see.

Cons:
» Considering this game is ten years old (I can't believe it!) it's absolutely magnificent. I just wish there had been a campaign like CZ.

My rating for CSS is 8/10. I took into account the length the game has been released and some of the technical factors in regards to the game engine and blockages that may have come up. The only thing that stopped it reaching a nine was the no campaign. I wish they had that!
